trans-unit.source: As business becomes increasingly more international, companies require

seg-source.mrk: As business becomes increasingly more international, companies require

target.mrk: As business becomes increasingly more international, companies require

trans-unit.source: products and information to be localized into various languages. Localization <content-1/>is not only translation, but also adaptation for a particular language and country. <content-2/>If your website, software, online course, or other product requires localization, you should internationalize it first to avoid costly, time-consuming reengineering.

seg-source.mrk: products and information to be localized into various languages.
Localization <content-1/>is not only translation, but also adaptation for a particular language and country.
<content-2/>If your website, software, online course, or other product requires localization, you should internationalize it first to avoid costly, time-consuming reengineering.

target.mrk: products and information to be localized into various languages.
Localization <content-1/>is not only translation, but also adaptation for a particular language and country.
<content-2/>If your website, software, online course, or other product requires localization, you should internationalize it first to avoid costly, time-consuming reengineering.

trans-unit.source: Internationalization is preparation that ensures your localization process will be streamlined and cost-effective. From the experts at Globalization Group, Inc., here are some tips to get started on the technical side:

trans-unit.source: Internationalization Summarized

seg-source.mrk: Internationalization Summarized

target.mrk: Internationalization Summarized

trans-unit.source: 1 error may cost only $1,000<content-1/>to fix in internationalization.<content-2/>Alternatively, 1 error may cost $25,000 to fix after localizing into 25 languages, and it may cost $25,000 more with each new<content-3/>product version if the correction<content-4/>is not rolled back to the source.

seg-source.mrk: 1 error may cost only $1,000<content-1/>to fix in internationalization.<content-2/>Alternatively, 1 error may cost $25,000 to fix after localizing into 25 languages, and it may cost $25,000 more with each new<content-3/>product version if the correction<content-4/>is not rolled back to the source.

target.mrk: 1 error may cost only $1,000<content-1/>to fix in internationalization.<content-2/>Alternatively, 1 error may cost $25,000 to fix after localizing into 25 languages, and it may cost $25,000 more with each new<content-3/>product version if the correction<content-4/>is not rolled back to the source.

trans-unit.source: According to the Localization <content-1/>Industry Standards Association, proper internationalization has cut localization time and costs by <content-2/>upwards of 50% for many <content-3/>companies.

seg-source.mrk: According to the Localization <content-1/>Industry Standards Association, proper internationalization has cut localization time and costs by <content-2/>upwards of 50% for many <content-3/>companies.

target.mrk: According to the Localization <content-1/>Industry Standards Association, proper internationalization has cut localization time and costs by <content-2/>upwards of 50% for many <content-3/>companies.

trans-unit.source: Internationalize from the beginning to prevent the need for such fixes and dramatically save on both time and costs.

seg-source.mrk: Internationalize from the beginning to prevent the need for such fixes and dramatically save on both time and costs.

target.mrk: Internationalize from the beginning to prevent the need for such fixes and dramatically save on both time and costs.

trans-unit.source: Problems can arise in 7 different areas that will either prevent localization from being completed or require reengineering that makes it more expensive. Internationalization-savvy developers reduce time and costs associated with localization when they answer “yes” to each of the following questions:

seg-source.mrk: Problems can arise in 7 different areas that will either prevent localization from being completed or require reengineering that makes it more expensive.
Internationalization-savvy developers reduce time and costs associated with localization when they answer “yes” to each of the following questions:

target.mrk: Problems can arise in 7 different areas that will either prevent localization from being completed or require reengineering that makes it more expensive.
Internationalization-savvy developers reduce time and costs associated with localization when they answer “yes” to each of the following questions:

trans-unit.source: 1. Regional Settings: <content-1>Are regional settings easily switched to different locales throughout?</content-1>

seg-source.mrk: Regional Settings: <content-1>Are regional settings easily switched to different locales throughout?</content-1>

target.mrk: Regional Settings: <content-1>Are regional settings easily switched to different locales throughout?</content-1>

trans-unit.source: 3. Translatable Text: <content-1>Is all translatable text externalized into resource files and/or tagged so that it can be extracted via filters instead of manual labor?</content-1>

seg-source.mrk: Translatable Text: <content-1>Is all translatable text externalized into resource files and/or tagged so that it can be extracted via filters instead of manual labor?</content-1>

target.mrk: Translatable Text: <content-1>Is all translatable text externalized into resource files and/or tagged so that it can be extracted via filters instead of manual labor?</content-1>

trans-unit.source: <content-1>Reduce the risk of human error by avoiding manual copy/paste methods. For example, can you export all your Flash or text strings to XML files? Do you also have the original source files for embedded movies and audio?</content-1><content-2/><content-3><content-4/></content-3><content-5>4 . Over-Externalization: </content-5><content-6>Are non-translatable strings (i.e. code) separated from translatable text so that the code does not break?</content-6>

seg-source.mrk: <content-1>Reduce the risk of human error by avoiding manual copy/paste methods.

For example, can you export all your Flash or text strings to XML files? Do you also have the original source files for embedded movies and audio?</content-1><content-2/><content-3><content-4/></content-3><content-5>4 .
Over-Externalization: </content-5><content-6>Are non-translatable strings (i.e. code) separated from translatable text so that the code does not break?</content-6>

target.mrk: <content-1>Reduce the risk of human error by avoiding manual copy/paste methods.

For example, can you export all your Flash or text strings to XML files? Do you also have the original source files for embedded movies and audio?</content-1><content-2/><content-3><content-4/></content-3><content-5>4 .
Over-Externalization: </content-5><content-6>Are non-translatable strings (i.e. code) separated from translatable text so that the code does not break?</content-6>

trans-unit.source: This is not a terribly common issue, but should be considered nevertheless.

seg-source.mrk: This is not a terribly common issue, but should be considered nevertheless.

target.mrk: This is not a terribly common issue, but should be considered nevertheless.

trans-unit.source: 5. Text Expansion: <content-1>Is there space and flexibility within source files that allows for text expansion typically associated with a good translation? Is this true for both written and audio components?</content-1>

seg-source.mrk: Text Expansion: <content-1>Is there space and flexibility within source files that allows for text expansion typically associated with a good translation? Is this true for both written and audio components?</content-1>

target.mrk: Text Expansion: <content-1>Is there space and flexibility within source files that allows for text expansion typically associated with a good translation? Is this true for both written and audio components?</content-1>

trans-unit.source: Text length can expand 30% or more in many translations, and very short strings of text can expand up to 300%. Translations into Asian characters may contract in length but expand vertically.

seg-source.mrk: Text length can expand 30% or more in many translations, and very short strings of text can expand up to 300%.
Translations into Asian characters may contract in length but expand vertically.

target.mrk: Text length can expand 30% or more in many translations, and very short strings of text can expand up to 300%.
Translations into Asian characters may contract in length but expand vertically.

trans-unit.source: 6. Image Text: <content-1>Has hard coding of text in images been limited whenever possible?</content-1>

seg-source.mrk: Image Text: <content-1>Has hard coding of text in images been limited whenever possible?</content-1>

target.mrk: Image Text: <content-1>Has hard coding of text in images been limited whenever possible?</content-1>

trans-unit.source: Text can still have an embedded appearance when using CSS, javascript, and other tricks to overlay text.

seg-source.mrk: Text can still have an embedded appearance when using CSS, javascript, and other tricks to overlay text.

target.mrk: Text can still have an embedded appearance when using CSS, javascript, and other tricks to overlay text.

trans-unit.source: <content-1>At the very least, save all editable image files. (i.e. PSD, AI, etc.)</content-1><content-2/><content-3><content-4/></content-3><content-5>7. Concatenated Strings: </content-5><content-6>Have string concatenations been limited whenever possible?</content-6>

trans-unit.source: Translators often need to restructure sentences or indicate word gender/plurality, but some variables can make that awkward or impossible. Externalize variables when possible.
